abstract: Sotheby's will auction a suite of four bronze sculptures of a woman's back that Matisse created over a period of 23 years beginning in 1908.
snippet: Sotheby's will auction a suite of four bronze sculptures of a woman's back that Matisse created over a period of 23 years beginning in 1908.
lead_paragraph: Since January experts at Sotheby's have been trying to privately sell a suite of four bronze sculptures of a woman's back that Matisse created over a period of 23 years beginning in 1908. The works belong to the Burnett Foundation in Forth Worth, and at the time the sale was announced, neither Sotheby's nor the foundation would say what the asking price was, although dealers approached by the auction house reported that they were hoping for around $200 million for all four.
